Name: Tetradrachm of Ptolemy VI
Description: Tetradrachm of Ptolemy VI minted in Paphos (Cyprus). Anverse: head of a king (Ptolemy I?) with diadem and aegis, on the right. Reverse: eagle above thunderbolt, on the left; in the field, on the left, LKA.; on the right, PA. Mintage's position 12.00 hours.
